CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 19, 1952, pg. 2 reads: "Continue Rent Controls? - Joseph Watson, service officer of Sportsmen's Post 913, American Legion, pleads with City Council at the public hearing on the resolution to extend rent controls until April 30, 1953. Mr. Watson was one of those who pleaded that continued rent controls are needed to prevent the gouging of those who cannot afford deluxe apartments.  The Pittsburgh Real Estate Board led the opposition to further controls, contending that there is no shortage of housing.  Their representatives failed to establish that the vacancies cited were within the price range below $70 per month.  Council is expected to pass the...tion early next week. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Joseph Watson, service officer of Sportsmen's Post 913 American Legion, speaking to Pittsburgh City Council during public hearing on rent control, City County Building
